offerDesc:
Infant Crisis Services 
Requesting items from its disaster relief wish list, which includes: Good Start Gentle formula, Good Start Soy formula, diapers (sizes 1-6), wipes, sippy cups, bottles, baby wash and blankets or quilts. All in-kind donations received in the coming weeks will be used to give direct and immediate support to babies and toddlers affected by the May 20 tornado.
I have a chainsaw, a 5x10 flatbed trailer and a weekend to help. I am looking for somewhere to start. Call Brian at 512-925-6337

American Red Cross 
Fixed Feeding Site

Wayland Bonds Elementary
address: 14025 S May Ave Oklahoma City, OK 73170

Receiving center for work gloves, bottled water and Gatorade. Donations are also being accepted there. Make checks to CHCC and put “tornado relief” in the memo.

Fixed Feeding Site

Newcastle Storm Shelter

i live in okc i have spent my max on supplies etc for the tornado victims but if there is anything i can do physically do to help like clean up debris, watching children, transportation, etc PLEASE call me at 4056200361 i would love to help in any way possible

American Red Cross Shelter 
Saint Andrew's United Methodist Church

Shelter Capacity : 30
Current Residents : 4

Plaza Mayor at the Crossroads
Opened its doors to organizations working to provide supplies to those displaced by the Moore tornado. In addition to being a command post for the Red Cross, and a delivery, sorting and distribution point for the Salvation Army, Plaza Mayor is accepting donations at the mall's southwest corner near the old J.C. Penney loading dock. For more information, call 631-4422.

American Red Cross Shelter
Moore Community Center

Shelter Capacity : 0
Current Residents : 23

We are partnered with Operation Blessing to send out volunteer groups, register for aid or to serve

http://hbcmoore.org/moore
Women's clothing size 4-6

CrossPointe Church
Opening up its community center to volunteers from other areas who are coming to help with relief efforts and need a place to stay. If you are sponsoring a group coming to help, call Brandy White at 329-5405 to make arrangements.
University of Oklahoma is opening housing up for any affected individuals and families of the storm
Able to help clean and serve

Environmental Management Inc. in Carney

Current needs are: leather work gloves, shovels, rakes, Gatorade and contractor trash bags. They do not need water or clothes.

Crossings Community Church
Accepting bottled water and energy/sports drinks; nonperishable items, including protein and granola bars, diapers and work gloves. Drop off items between 7:30 a.m. and 7 p.m. weekdays. 
Financial donations can be made online at crossingsokc.org/giving. Sign in or create an account, select “missions” and then select “disaster relief fund” to send your donation directly to tornado relief.
address: 2208 W Hefner Rd, Oklahoma City, OK 73120

offerDesc: We are collecting Homeschool Curriculum for those families affected by the storms. A "Free Shopping" day will be held in August as families prepare for the upcoming school year. Visit our Facebook Page to stay current with drop off locations/dates of collection as well as the shopping day plans. https://www.facebook.com/OklahomaHomeschoolTornadoVictimsHelp
Harding Fine Arts Academy is holding a collection for supplies to drop off that will be delievered to the impacted areas next week. Drop of Saturday between 10-6
Shelter for volunteers. Please message me with your contact information.
Can provide any help, transportation, debri clean up, serving in anyway needed. Have truck, trailer and tools. Bringing a small load of donations Available 3-7 June. Call Jeff at 325-668-7228

http://www.cnn.com/2013/05/20/us/severe-weather
Shelter in nice home in Edmond for 1-4 people, children welcome.

Quail Springs Baptist Church
Requesting donations of water, Gatorade, wipes, individually wrapped snacks, hand sanitizer, diapers, baby formula, hand towels, work gloves and sunscreen. Items can be dropped off on the north side of the building. Checks can be made payable to QSBC Storm Relief. For more information, call 755-9240.
address: 14613 N May Ave, Oklahoma City, OK 73134

offerDesc: We are accepting donations for May 20th Tornado victims. More info call 405-728-7700 or visit our Facebook page The Gate Church (www.facebook.com/thegateokc) WE ARE ALSO ACCEPTING VOLUNTEERS
address: 7700 N. Council Rd. Oklahoma City, OK 73132

offerDesc:
American Red Cross 
Fixed Feeding Site

Expo Center
University of Oklahoma Couch Restaurants is giving away hot meals to those in need after being displaced by the May 20th tornado. Housing is also available.

Facebook.com/cttrucktook
Foundations For Learning Center
Details:
 
We are looking to load the truck the 2nd or 3rd week of June and send it down. We will have a drive the day of from 9-5 and donations will be accepted all day. Location most likely will be in Colchester. We are working with a few contacts regarding a truck but if you know someone with a truck or trailer please contact us.
 
Current list of needs:
 
Food:
*WATER: Gallons & Cases, ANY!
*Gatorade/Powerade: Powder or bottled
*Crystal Light Packets, any packets that can be added to bottled water
*Ready to Eat Food & Non Perishable Food: Easy Mac, Tuna Packets, Ramen Noodles, etc.
*Condiments: Packets preferred (Ketchup, Mustard, Sugar, etc.)
*Eating Utensils: Plastic Forks, Spoons & Knives
*Hand Can Openers...not electric!
*Unopened/Unexpired Baby Forumla, Food including boxes and Jars etc.
*Canned Food
*Individually wrapped snacks
*Diabetic foods *Soft drinks
 
Hygiene:
*Shampoo & Conditioner
*Body Wash, Soap Liquid & Bar
*Deoderant
*Sunscreen & Aloe
*Bug Spray
*Feminine hygiene products; pads, tampons, etc.
*Anti-Bacterial lotion & hand sanitizer
*Hair brushes/combs
*Dental Hygiene: Toothpaste, Floss, Toothbrushes, Mouth Wash
*Chapstick
*Contact solution/cases *Denture cleaner/cream *Nail files *Razors, Shaving cream *Towels – New only please *Travel-size lotions, shampoo and conditioner
*Wash cloths – New only please
* Adult diapers
 
Medical:
 
*First Aid Kit & First Aid Products 
* OTC medication- (Benadryl, Ibuprofen, Tylenol, etc)
*Albuterol *Nebulizers *IV Starters, Fluids
 
 
Clothing:
 
*Closed-toe shoes
*Adult, Children & Infant clothing, please make sure it is clean as there is no immediate access to laundry facilities
*JACKETS (gets cold at night) 
*Underwear, socks, bras etc. (NEW ONLY PLEASE)
 
Household:
*Clothes Pins
*Blankets, bed sheets, linens
*Disposable Items: Paper plates, plastic cups, napkins, etc.
*Ziplock Bags all sizes, snack, sandwich, freezer etc. 
*Cleaning & Paper Products: Clorox Wipes, Lysol Wipes, Toilet Paper, Paper Towels, etc.
*Laundry Detergent: Bottle, Box or Single Packets
*Bleach
*Dish Detergent
 
Pets:
*Dog & Cat Food
*Cat Litter & Litter Pans
*Large Animal Supplies: Troughs, Halters, Lead Ropes, Fly Spray, Buckets for Water & Grain, etc. 
*Large Animal Corrals/panels - Anything that we can contain large animals in! 
 
Baby Items:
 
*Baby/Toddler Diapers
*Baby Tylenol *Baby shampoo
*Pull-ups-all sizes *Bottles *Car seats *Diapers-all sizes *Diaper rash cream *Lotion *Pedialyte
 
Clean-Up Supplies:
*Shovels, Axes, Rakes
*Gloves; Work, Rubber & Serving
*BIG tarps ..to cover houses
*Heavy duty trash bags & trash cans (any size)
*Safety Vests
*Eye Protection: Safety Glasses, Sun Glasses, Reading Glasses etc.
*Contractor Bags
*Portable radios/walkie-talkies
*Cleaning brushes *Dust masks *Gas cans – EMPTY ONLY *Hammers
 
Camping Supplies:
*Tents
*Flash Lights & Batteries (Size C & D)
*Batteries any size including AA & AAA
*Storage boxes, bins & totes (ANY SIZE) Can be a dual purpose...need to fill truck and they are also requesting totes, tubs and containers to store items in and distribute to people
* Coolers; regular, styrofoam etc.
*Lanterns: Oil or Battery Operated
*Extension Cords
*Box Fans
*Ponchos
*Lawn Chairs
*Charcoal
*Sleeping Bags
*Pillows
*Air mattresses *Charcoal grills *Rope-all types
 
Misc. & other:
*Kids Toys (All Ages): Coloring Books, Crayons, & activities for children 
* Stuffed Animals
*Board Games & DVDS
*Gas Cards (Needed to take supplies down)
*Phone Chargers
*Bibles
*Books for all ages
address: Foundations For Learning; 60 Deming Street, South Windsor, CT 06074

offerDesc: I will be in the Moore area Sunday and would like to help. If there is something my young children can help with, that would be great. Otherwise I am open to anything.

Emmanuel Baptist Church 

Currently collecting:
- Non-perishable and ready to eat food
- Work Gloves
- Trash bags
- Water
- Gatorade

NO CLOTHING

Oklahoma State University's Parking and Transit Services 

Accepting donations from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. through Friday in the parking lot at the intersection of Hall of Fame and Washington in Stillwater. Water, non-perishable food items, diapers, toiletries, snack foods, work gloves, Gatorade, sunscreen, baby wipes, hand sanitizer, ibuprofen, shovels, rakes and buckets are needed. No clothing. All items will be donated to the American Red Cross. For more information, call (405) 744-6260.

offerDesc:
Organizing & equipping volunteers into zones for cleanup

http://servemoore.com

Free Data Recovery for tornado victims.

FREE JPG ONLY logical data recovery for those who lost their homes in the Moore tornado. If your family photos are lost on a hard drive affected by the May 20th tornado we will recover these precious family memories at no charge if a logical recovery is possible. We are also discounting full logical recovery to a flat rate of $99. (normally priced up to $900.) Clean Room recoveries for physically damaged hard drives are also discounted by $500.

Visit web site to get started:
http://www.CrashedDriveRecovery.com
Click the "Get Started Now" link and use the discount code: MooreTorn
If you need more info or have any questions, please call 405-622-4475.

American Red Cross 
Fixed Feeding Site

Walker Center Dorm

offerDesc:
DeVry University

Collecting donations from 9 a.m. to 7 p.m. through Thursday.
Accepting bottled or filtered water containers, Gatorade, non-perishable food, pre-packed snacks, diapers, formula, wipes, hand sanitizers, gloves, trash bags, rakes, shovels, flashlights, batteries, sunscreen. No clothes, bedding or housing items accepted.

My 2 sisters and I will be driving to Norman from Omaha, NE June 1 and are looking to volunteer for clean up on June 2. Not sure where help will be needed a week from now, so if you have any ideas, please let me know!
I have a fenced yard at my house and have two small dogs but they are friendly and i can take 1-2 small to medium dogs please call if you want to bring them here. call or text me 405-487-7232.

OK Humane is currently housing displaced animals at our facility. We currently have one location where we are accepting donations. We are currently looking for Needles (all sixes but preferably 22 gauge), Latex gloves, surgical gowns, shoe covers, dog shampoo, #40 clipper blades and chlorhexidine scrub. We appreciate all of your assistance in this difficult time.

Craig's Roofing, Inc is accepting donations to be taken to the Shawnee/Moore tornado victims. We will be taking donations to them on Monday and will volunteer in whatever capacity we are needed at that time.

Rose State College's Office of Student Activities
Accepting donations of bottled water, canned goods, diapers, sports drinks and nonperishable food items. Monetary donations will be forwarded to the Oklahoma Red Cross. For more information, call 733-7458.

Price Law Group has over 20 years of experience in protecting clients from insurance companies during your time of crisis. Our team is skilled in determining the best option for your unique situation. With offices conveniently located throughout AZ, CA, CO, FL, KS, MN, MO, NC, OK,NJ, NM, NV, NY, PA and TX, we make it simple to serve you.

Our team at Price Law Group is composed of a dedicated team of Insurance Claim Advocates who is a nationwide team serving several states. We have helped thousands of homeowners who were facing battles with their insurance company and provided them with a legal solution to their dire situation. If your claim isn't satisfactory, choose our firm for personal service and attention to detail in pursuing your interests.

Brandon Carrillo 
Direct: 866.430.2193 
Main: 866.694.1444
Fax: 866.430.2194
Email: Brandon@PriceLawGroup.com
Website: www.InsClaimHelp.com
address: 3030 NW Expressway Suite 200, Oklahoma Ciry, OK 73112

offerDesc: I have women clothes in sizes 4-6 to donate. I also have handbags.

Graceway Baptist Church 
Dropoff location for donations of bottled water, ready-to-eat food items, ibuprofen, band aids, gloves, batteries and hand sanitizer. www.gracewayokc.org

I sell Thirty-One bags, wallets, and thermals. All commission earned on sales in May and June will be donated to the Oklahoma Red Cross to help with relief efforts across the state. My website for more information is; 
https://www.mythirtyone.com/forMoore/
Shelter for volunteers. 2 bedrooms. Additional Bonus room with 2 futonsPrivate home. Please message me with your contact information.
I am seeking any opportunity to assist disaster victims in Oklahoma. I am available to drive to the OKC area and help out in any capacity.

A friend and I drove down from Wichita to help my grandparents clean up, but their mess wasn't as bad as we first thought it would be. So now we're here ready to help sort through rubble or pick up debris or whatever we can. Call or text 405-570-5664 and we'll do our best to help as many as we can before we have to go back.

Science Museum Oklahoma

Serving as a dropoff point for relief donations, including bottled water, Gatorade-type sports drinks, diapers, baby wipes, baby formula and canned foods at the museum box office during operating hours. Hours are 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. weekdays, 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. Saturdays and 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. Sundays. For more information, call 405-602-6664 or www.sciencemuseumok.org.

Lakehoma Church of Christ 
Accepting donations of rescue supplies and personal items from 11 a.m. to 2 p.m. Wednesday. Requested items include water, Gatorade, blankets, pillows, shovels, gloves, non-perishable food items, toothpaste, toothbrushes, shaving cream, diapers, shampoo, conditioner, baby food and body wash. People can also bring donations after 7 p.m. Wednesday. Donations will go to the Red Cross. For more information, call 376-2883.

The Oklahoma Farm Bureau and Affiliated Companies' 
Accepting donations for those affected by the recent tornado. Critical items needed are bottled water, sports drinks, paper towels, disinfectant wipes, individually wrapped snack food, diapers, baby formula and work gloves. A trailer on the office's west side will accept donations for as long as needed. For more information, call 523-2347.
address: 2501 N Stiles Ave, Oklahoma City, OK 73105

offerDesc: I know I'm 25 miles from Moore, but I have room in my home for a family of 4 +/-. I can offer transportion (a full size truck & suv) & Childcare due to I'm a stay at home mom of a toddler & baby (girls). We don't have much money but we have alot of love. If can help call or text 405-496-3318
The Blakeburn Clinic is collecting non-perishable food and clothing from now until Friday, May 24th. All donations are appreciated.
Offering foster care to 1-2 dogs (medium to small). Fenced, gated, and locked yard.

Fixed Feeding Site 

Eastlake Elementary

Bottled water, Gatorade, baby wipes, diapers, baby formula, hand towels, individually wrapped snacks, work gloves, shovels and dog food can be dropped off 24 hours a day through May 31. For more information, call 580-331-9662.

Disseminating info via social media - unable to give on-the-ground assistance so trying to help in this way. Direct message @makalove on Twitter, text 405-872-6252, or email info you need sent out to maka.opokrelief@gmail.com

Bottled water, Gatorade, baby wipes, diapers, baby formula, hand towels, individually wrapped snacks, work gloves, shovels and dog food can be dropped off 24 hours a day through May 31. Checks will also be accepted. For more information, call 354-1711 or go to www.cityofyukonok.gov.

We are offering temporary foster care for families who have been reunited with their dogs but have no place to keep them(example: staying with friends, staying in hotel). Our phone number is 513-7297. We also have an active list of individuals who have offered their homes to pet friendly dogs and cats that need overnight care until their families can find a place to go.

We are also taking donations for the Animal Resource Center and Moore Animal Shelter. We do NOT need dog food. Crates, cleaning supplies and Petsmart, Walmart, or PETCO gift cards greatly appreciated! We are open until 7:00 pm and 7am-7pm tomorrow for donations.

Details:
 
We are looking to load the truck the 2nd or 3rd week of June and send it down. We will have a drive the day of from 9-5 and donations will be accepted all day. Location most likely will be in Colchester. We are working with a few contacts regarding a truck but if you know someone with a truck or trailer please contact us.
 
Current list of needs:
 
Food:
*WATER: Gallons & Cases, ANY!
*Gatorade/Powerade: Powder or bottled
*Crystal Light Packets, any packets that can be added to bottled water
*Ready to Eat Food & Non Perishable Food: Easy Mac, Tuna Packets, Ramen Noodles, etc.
*Condiments: Packets preferred (Ketchup, Mustard, Sugar, etc.)
*Eating Utensils: Plastic Forks, Spoons & Knives
